Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Thomas871
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 children under the age of 5 years old. The place was horrible. The noise was very loud with many young college student drinking, partying, and drugs. We requested a refund and the hotel refused. Horrible customer service. I would not waste your money. The are nicer places to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night (thank goodness) Reserved a junior suite. 4 adults Plumbers putty around bar tap to stop leak! Pulled out couch to sleep on only to discover dirty towels underneath. Bedding for couch on top shelf on closet not sure really if they were clean. Ugly, dark shower......refused to use in the morning. Should not have stayed or atleast asked for a better room if possible. Paid for the view I guess because it was not the room shown on the web pages!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time”
Reviews.Author: KarenFJ
Reviews.Content: This was a really great hotel for the price. Feb 25 - March 3. Location couldn't have been better and the room we got (412) was perfect. Spent time on the balconey watching the surfers and the dolphins :) and celebrating our anniversary. The bed was amazing!!!! We were a bit concerned that we could be hitting the "spring break" time, but didn't - and never once did we have an issue with noise. We really wanted to be close to the beach, boardwalk, bike rentals, restaurants and nightlife and were had that at the Surfer. The staff were excellent - including Carlos the driver who can be found in the lobby most days :) We didn't rent a car, as this part of our trip was mostly intended to be at the beach, along the boardwalk and surfing - when we did want to venture off the beach area, we used Carlos. Best best place for breakfast is north along the boardwalk about 0.5mile to Kona's at the base of Crystal Pier - usually a line up, but good inexpensive food. Best place to rent bikes is right across from Kona's. Check-in staff provided lots of good tips and some discounts at various restaurants - Fat Fish was a great recommendation with the best fish taco's! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be closer to the beach”
Reviews.Author: LauraPPP
Reviews.Content: Only got 2 nights in San Diego had a great welcome when we arrived by a really helpful guy (Grady I think). Thanks to him we really maxed out on seeing as much as possible. Gave us maps, vouchers for dinner, helped us find info on surfing lessons, zoo, sorted out driver etc... Hotel was lovely only downfall was the shower which is not very flexible for tall people and no hair dryer. The hotel give free hot drinks 24hr a day. The hot choc is a must Recommend getting a car though as everything is spread out Would defo use again because the welcome was great

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: denmartravelbug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location, we woke every morning to surfers and dolphins. The staff was friendly and the price was reasonable. This was not the cleanest hotel we stayed in. Our first room was missing locks on the patio door and bathroom window. We asked to move and was put into another room without any issues. This hotel could be amazing with the right renovations. I would have no issues staying here again but it wouldn't be my first choice. Lastly the World Famous restaurant was absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “third times a charm.”
Reviews.Author: skeeterphxaz
Reviews.Content: went to check in to hotel first room they gave us was not cleaned second hotel room the bath tub water was coming out so fast it would fill the bath tub up in 5 minutes the third room was good .the sreen door fell off when we opened it but the rest of the room was fine .no table or chairs in room . no blow dryers in good location very comfortable bed that was really nice no internet service the whole time we were there and others were complaining to. but so much bull we really would not stay here again stay at the bech cottages in pacific beach nice room ask for a partial ocean view they have nice views of the ocean.right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Kelly C
Reviews.Content: The Surfer Beach Hotel is an awesome place to stay if you want to be on the water in San Diego.Right on the beach and right next to a great restaurant " World Famous" and a great little coffee joint.Minutes from sea world and lots of classic San Diego attractions. It wasn't until we left the Surfer Beach that we discovered just how awesome the staff here is. When my daughter left her stuffed whale from Sea World in the room. We called the hotel and they agreed to mail it to us in Vegas. Which completed my daughters Sea World experience and my experience of staying in this great San Diego get away. Will totally come back and stay with these guys when I come back to SD

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly ill equipped, overpriced, and noisy”
Reviews.Author: YVRtoN
Reviews.Content: We rented the 2 bedroom, 1 bath suite for 3 nights. While the panaromic ocean views from the balcony were beautiful, it did not make up for the lack of service, the noise that we had to endure 2 out of 3 nights, or the general uncleanliness of the suite. The kitchen was lacking basic equipment like paper towels, dish soap or dish cloths, and maid service never cleaned our kitchen at all. Both days we came back at 4 pm and the rooms still had not been cleaned. There was loud banging all night from the kitchen/bar below, and pounding music 2 out of 3 nights well past 2 am. The shag carpet was disgusting, and the wifi did not work well. The towels were old and stained, and they didn't provided enough until our last day. They tried to charge us $479 per night, way over the quoted rate on the phone. After getting no sleep the first night we complained, and they immediately reduced the rate $100 (to the originally quoted price). After the last night of noise and having to phone front desk to complain, they took another $80 off the total bill. A nice gesture, but does not make up for the lack of sleep we experienced on this trip. I'm all for retro hotels, but under no circumstances would I recommend this one to friends. One note: the maids, when they did finally clean our rooms, were friendly and did the best job they could under the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “The Surfer”
Reviews.Author: ROBERT D
Reviews.Content: Great location, a little on the aging side,( but upgraded in the last few years) which I like in a beachfront Hotel. Great restaurant downstairs- World Famous-

Reviews.Title: “Great location--do not get the handicapped room!”
Reviews.Author: kedDenver
Reviews.Content: PB is a great place to stay--that being said, at the Surfer we were assigned the handicapped room, which apparently is the only non-balcony room at the hotel! Since there is no air-conditioning at these hotels by the beach, that meant we had to leave our windows open, and though it provided little comfort (room was on the corner so there was no cross breeze), it was scary since the room was on the first floor. We met two couples who had been broken into at other hotels, so it was a little scary (not to mention extremely hot and humid). We tried unsuccessfully to get a room change--apparently no one else wanted that room either! Ugh!

Reviews.Title: “It's a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Marie H
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled. Not every room has been renovated. The location of the hotel was excellent, however, the hotel itself was terrible. Musky moldy smell everywhere, the ceiling in our room (407) was peeling due to a leaky roof and a piece of the paint actually fell on my face during night. There was no seating - not a single chair, no microwave, no coffee maker, not even a hair dryer. The shower was disgusting and I really didn't want to touch the shower floor without flip flops on. The shower curtain fell at the lightest touch. The housekeeping personnel did not KNOCK and walked in on us...The sink did not have a stopper - make sure you don't drop your ring in there. Our last night we were really cold and tried to turn on the heater but it didn't work. The pool was too cold to swim in for the weather. When I complained during check out there was not even an apology from the front desk personnel, all we got was just a dull "ok" The only nice thing about this hotel was the location and a nice big flat screen tv in the room. Parking was $15 a night and never mentioned during booking. The railings on the balcony are lose - make sure you don't lean on them or you might fall. Oh..and their elevator operating permit has been expired for a while, too...just a bad hotel all over.

Reviews.Title: “Almost, but not quite.”
Reviews.Author: seasay
Reviews.Content: Just came back from San Diego and stay at the Surfer. First off, it is in a great location and does have some nice views. The beds are very nice and the updates are pretty nice. Pool is well kept and was never crowded. However...Although our room was quite large, it had a spectacular view of the roof above the restaurant as well as it's air conditioning unit and giant exhaust fan that looked like it had survived many wars. So what am I saying? Make sure when you make a reservation that you specify to be away from the street/restaurant side. Very, very noisy and ugly unless you look around/past the roof. Especially in the morning when the delivery trucks show up. Also, since our room was on the end by the stairs, we had no front side window, like most other rooms, to get any kind of cross draft to cool the room down. Luckily they provide a fan that moved a little air but more importantly, drowned out much of the street noise. It did, however, help all of the stale cigarette smoke from all of the other guests, flow in. Good god! It felt like we were the only ones not smoking on the balconies or around the hotel. I was going to say something but since the employees were headed out for a smoke too, I thought better than to bother them. Another very important note. It is never a good sign when one of the cleaning staff warns you to smell the towels first to make sure they have been properly cleaned. She knew we had kids and , "did not want them to get sick." Not good. It became a joke with us to "name that stain" on the towels. Many had one kind or another. They also could never seem to quite get the quantity correct. Oh, and lets not forget the tiny "cave" shower with the shower head at chest level, and I 'm only 5' 9". Or that they did not clean or change out the coffee mugs. We did not have cereal in the room, but we stepped on some:) All in all, a fair hotel at best. They seem to be trying, but can't seem to make it feel better than your average roadside motel somewhere. If you want the experience of staying on the beach, I would personally recommend the Blue Sea Lodge next door.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: i was worried after booking this hotel when i was reading the reviews about how dirty the hotel was . we booked the ocean view suite, and it was beautiful ! there were ocean views from the balcony and from the door to the room. it was clean and very pretty. the sheets were nice and the tv was huge, the showers were small but clean. the fact that there was no air was not a problem, we left the windows and balcony door open and it was very cool, we didnt even use the fan. the pool was very nice, and cleaned every morning, and was nice to sit around . the best part was how close it was to the beach though ! i would definitely recommend it to anyone going on a surfing trip !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lackluster Service”
Reviews.Author: enwalton1
Reviews.Content: The Surfer Beach Hotel is located in an ideal location if you would like to spend time throughout San Diego. The hotel is located right on the beach in Pacific Beach. It is a young area of town, so be prepared to hear noise late at night. However, it's a short car ride to downtown San Diego, Coronado Island, La Jolla and Del Mar. The service was not impressive. Our hotel room was not cleaned over the weekend. When questioned about the lack of cleaning, the front desk clerk made up a story about needing to indicate that we wanted it cleaned over the weekend. Upon check-out another front desk clerk indicated that we were told incorrect information. If you know that you will not be spending much time in your room, then I would recommend the Surfer Beach hotel - a decent place to sleep at night, with a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Love Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: janiti
Reviews.Content: and have the plastic licence plate holder to prove it. I almost didn't book this place, the price was too cheap for oceanfront/view, and some of the reviews were not good. I sometimes wonder what on earth people expect. I expect clean, and I have reasonable expectations based upon the age and price of the property. So, I was so pleasantly surprised by the updated rooms with big flatscreens, great balconies all oceanviews, large sink/counter wash area with very nice toiletries, and new clean duvet covers that are washable, and plenty of pillows. It was clean, clean, clean. The shower is freshly tiled with cool looking rustic tiles. If you are hanging around your hotel all day you are a loser and don't deserve to be writing a review. Two steps from the front lobby (where there are very friendly staff, and complimentary coffee and a selection of fine teas available 24/7) is the beach and boardwalk. Walk out to the Crystal Pier and dolphin-watch in the morning, or rent a bike and go all the way to Ocean Beach for breakfast, or step right and eat at the boardwalk cafe. After all, you are there for the beachfront location, and this is a great value for money place. Sleep with the sound of the ocean. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL, Gross and no air conditioning.”
Reviews.Author: Knghthwk
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money.. We went there for our 25 anniverary, and OMG it was AWFUL. First off they lost our reservations... even when I gave the women our confirmation number she couldn't find them.. She did get us a room with an ocean view, we get to the room and it looked gross. You know its bad, when my husband came out of the bath room and said.. DON'T take a shower WITH OUT your flip flops on.. My gym has better looking showers!!!! There is no air conditioning.. Our room had the "saftey light" on the balcony NO TURNING IT OFF.. so we couldn't leave the sliding glass door open for some AIR we were on the third floor.. (there was an old rusted fan in the room.. does nothing without cool air) but we couldn't sleep with a bright light on.. It was just awful.. so at 1230 am (7 hours after checking in) we checked out and went across the street to Best Western..

Reviews.Title: “will stay again for sure”
Reviews.Author: Deb50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here may 24 thru may 28,2011. booked a king room and was upgraded to a jr. suite with full ocean views for no charge. saw pilot whales from our balcony. you never have to drive because all restaurants are in walking distance. Tony Romas is right next door. Customer service was great. room was very clean. had a jetted tub. will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: PetuniaCake
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times. The hotel management is warm and accommodating, the suite was very comfortable. Housekeeping provided us daily with fresh towels, toiletries and sundries. We even brought our puppy with us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: suegalway_uk
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by the Information people in San Diego and so stayed for one night while we decided what to do. We were flexible so we could have chosen to stay the five nights we planned in Pacific Beach. Instead we moved on to the Catamaran. The Surfer Beach Hotel is not quite how it appears in the photographs and does have a motel feel to it. Our room was not clean. There is no bath, just a dark tiled shower in the corner of the bathroom - rather depressing. Having said that, the view of the ocean was marvellous (although side on). The pool was out of order when we were there but we were told we could use the Best Western facilities opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience - Beachfront Hotel, right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: TheLoaferPrinciple
Reviews.Content: Mission Beach has surfing, sand castles, sun bathing, football playing, and wakeboarding. Surfer Beach Hotel is directly on the beach. Most of the rooms have a view of the ocean. This is a 4 story hotel with elevator access, a restaurant onsite, and walking distance to board shops, restaurants, drug store, pizza places etc. People are laid back and friendly. There are a lot of rental villas, other motels, sandwich shops, gift shops, and things to do nearby. Parking is available at about 12 bucks a day onsite. Pets are allowed, but be aware that dogs are not allowed on the beach between 9 am and 4 pm. Teenagers, retirees, families with kids, vacationers, young couples, surfers, and beach bums are all there. A nice mix of nice people. Security is pretty good. Staff is very helpful and available 24 hours. Room had to double beds, a balcony, and a small fridge. There is also a pool in a wind protected area. Some days required a sweatshirt and other days required sun screen. Water was in the 50's but kids were in it. Recommend a wet suit if you want to be in the water more than 30 minutes in March. This is not a fancy place, but we were there for the sun, the beach, the water, the relaxation, and the family time. This was a perfect place for all that. Reminded me of Florida beach hotels.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel with comfortable bed and oceanview at affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: ChristineLW
Reviews.Content: hotel is clean.bed is comfortable. we got a room with ocean view at a very reasonable rate. you can hear the ocean waves from your room.we had a good, relaxing experience at a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel a bit of a let down overall”
Reviews.Author: scirishman
Reviews.Content: All I can say is the photographer who took the photos on the website is a genius! This is more of a motel and not a bad place to stay but the reality is some way short of expectations. We paid a room rate of $200 per night with 3rd night free in advance...yet friends just happened to stay on the Saturday we were there and got a walk up rate of $99! Perhaps if we'd paid $99 we would have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: SJNelson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not the nicest, but for the price you can't beat the location! It was within walking distance to good food, the beach and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Ripped us off of room and property!”
Reviews.Author: Blitheryidiot
Reviews.Content: Booded this "Junior Suite" one month in advance, called the morning of our stay to make sure all was well and "Juan" said, "Yes, you have an oceon front Junior Suite!"! I was happy and picked up my daughters and headed down to the beach, we checked in at 4 and he didn't say a word, got into my one bed dinky crummy room. Called the desk and said "This is NOT a suite by any means", they said "Oh, tomorrow you can have one, and we'll give ;you a discount for today". The worst part is that the second day, when we DID move to the nice Junior suite, in a Big Hurry, my 9 year old left her 200.00 Nintendo with games in a drawer. We called about it, the maid knew nothing, the next resident who was a scary Black haired woman with a daughter said nothing was there, so, some adult STOLE my daughter's Nintendo. Totally sucked. The beach is fun of course.. Lesson learned is when you get down to this area, trust no-one and everyone is after your money and your stuff, even your children's stuff. Sad but true. Lock up.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: DaveC64
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this place after reading some bad reviews on here. I can see how some people might have had bad experiences here - it's not the most stunning place - but my stay was pretty good. I stayed in room 302. There was a leak over the balcony, and the view was partially obscured by the run-down roof of the lower floor. It was a nice view though, right over Pacific Beach - I couldn't have asked for a better location in that respect. With Pacific Beach being such a loud and busy place, I'd expected a bad night's sleep here. Again, I was pleasantly surprised, the place managed to stay pretty quiet. The staff were a bit lacklustre. Checking in was a chore, and when we got into the room, there was no power cord for the alarm clock. Not a big deal, but I went down to the lobby to ask for one. I never got one. They were helpful in giving directions for the local busses (to get to downtown San Diego) though. We had to get the bus, as the carpark was so packed, it would've been a major gamble to take the car out of it (already having paid $12 for a pass) and risk not getting back in. Our room had no air con, and instead had a portable fan (marked "301", obviously in the wrong room - I wonder if the people in 301 had nothing?) which was actually OK. The TV hardly had any channels on, and there was no hairdryer. They did arrange the towels like a little man, with black stickers for eyes though (see photo...) It's worth mentioning, the stairs up to the rooms are pretty grim and seemed to be suffering from some sort of leak when i was there, which combined with the fact that there was barely any lighting made them fairly lethal. Overall, this is a pretty decent hotel, but clearly a bit too busy for its own good - the busy carpark, worn out staff, missing hairdryer and alarm cord - which is forgivable when the location is so close to a great beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Desertcouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for a quick midweek getaway. Perfect place!! Lovely views, Friendly staff, great location, safe, clean, great coffees an teas in the lobby, and the restaurant connected was wonderful! We will absolutely be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: aspen85206
Reviews.Content: My friends and I planned a girls vacation and were so excited. Our first impression of the room was that it felt a little old but we had an ocean view and a balcony so we were happy. That night as two of our friends fell asleep in their beds, the roaches started to come out. For hours we scanned the walls and smashed/caught them and put them into a ziplock bag to show the manager. We killed a total of 15 roaches before we switched hotels at 4am. We moved across the parking lot to the Best Western (cheaper, cleaner, friendlier staff--still with an ocean view!) The security guard at the Best Western actually helped us move all of our stuff across and up into our new, clean room. At the Surfer, we were in room 301 right above their restaurant which made us wonder what we really had for lunch that day! The desk clerk never apologized or offered to move us into a new room. Don't stay at this hotel!! I haven't read anything else on here about roaches (I checked these reviews before we even went) but where there's 15 in one room there's bound to be more! You've been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Updated Room”
Reviews.Author: pgh_esquire
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in a room that was fairly large (had a king bed, table, sofa, & kitchenette) & modernly redecorated. Grounds were clean & well kept. Great location on PB (I just don't get PB, but that's another story) with a very good restaurant next door. Only downside was that the sliding screen door was damaged. Called the manager, who promised to send maintenance, which didn't show. Fortunately, the weather was sufficiently cool that we didn't need to sleep with the door open.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good accomodations”
Reviews.Author: rbksmitty
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel just steps away from the beach, then look no further. The accomodations are "good," not great. But, are you really visiting PB to spend time in the hotel? The rooms are small and don't have AC, but with all that PB has to offer you won't be spending much time inside anyway. Unless its scorching hot (which is rare for San Diego), then you won't be affected by not having AC either. At night, just sleep with the balcony door open and enjoy the cool ocean breeze. Just a helpful traveller's tip, if you do book at this hotel, ask for a room on the 4th floor. The views are stunning. In short, you're paying for the location, not 5 star accomodations. If you're just looking for a safe, clean place to drop your bags and sleep, then this is the place for you. If you're looking for something a bit more fancy, then I would recommend looking elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “The Location is What You are Paying for!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PetuniaCake
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times before. The Surfer sits across the the boardwalk from a huge, vast, breathtaking beach with miles of shoreline and that's what you're paying for! I could find so many things in this hotel to gripe about, but that's not the reason we stay; it's the opportunity to hear the ocean roar at night, to watch the sunsets and just totally relax, it's a casual, beachy-feel hotel. The management at this hotel always do their upmost time and time again to make our stay comfortable. And if the hotel is upgraded in the future, folk like us who enjoy the surroundings will be forced to pay the exorbitant prices comparable to the Blue Sea next door. During our past stays, we've figured out the excellent rooms, and request them before arrival which helps to have a fabulous vacation. Book through the hotel because if you book through a discount hotel site, you'll get exactly that, a discounted hotel room, which is NOT located in the best parts of the hotel (learned that through personal experience.) There are no microwaves or coffeemakers in the room, no free breakfasts, and you have to pay for parking $12 a day. They offer coffee and tea in the lobby. It's basically a no-frills hotel, but remember that you're "paying for the location."

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bgueva
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here based on the great price and found much more than just the fantastic location. We had a ground floor room and asked to be moved upstairs so that we could sit on the balcony. We were upgraded to a Jr suite for free and the room and view were fantastic. There is no air conditioner which is my biggest gripe but not a huge deal. The service was nice and World Famous next door has a great happy hour drink and food specials. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: CantWait4STT
Reviews.Content: Two of my girlfriends and I recently stayed at the Surfer Beach Hotel, for the second time. Both times, I have found the staff friendly, the location fantastic, and the room rate well worth it. You are literally steps from Pacific Beach (now a no-smoking, no-alcohol, no-pets beach). It's true that there is no A/C in the rooms, but we slept quite comfortably with the sliding glass door open, which allowed the ocean breeze to come through. Our room was clean, the beds and pillows were comfortable, and it was exactly the room I had requested when making my reservation. The only problem was fuzzy cable TV channels...but I'd rather watch the waves anyway.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning - Poor Value for Families - Dive Motel”
Reviews.Author: RocketJunkie
Reviews.Content: The room was hot and humid at night, making it hard to sleep. The noise level didn't help either. Little privacy. We caught the neighbors peeking into our room from the balcony while we slept. The beds were homemade with sharp corners that we kept banging into. Also, the screen to the bathroom window was missing, and was not fixed as promised. The stay was miserable!! We finally cut our loses and moved to a nice hotel, near Sea World, on Mission Bay. However, if your purpose in life is to surf and party, without the need for materialistic stuff like air conditioning, this may be the place for you... In my opinion, it should be torn down and replaced with a modern facility.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SJTCHT
Reviews.Content: OK, You are right ON the beach -- out your door, down the hotel steps, across the boardwalk and onto the sand!! Believe me, there aren't many hotels in San Diego that are like that!! Let me try to explain the room locations, as some have commented about this. The hotel is L-shaped. Any room 2nd floor or above has an ocean view -- if your room is in the lower digits (e.g. 301, 405, 207 -- up to 09), you'll be looking straight out from your room/patio to the ocean.; in rooms ending in 11-15 you will find the ocean 90 degrees to your right from your patio. I think that there are one or two corner rooms with NO beach view at all - avoid them if possible.. The very low numbered rooms (esp. 01-02) DO look out over a restaurant roof (esp. the third floor), but those are really nice rooms, and you still have a great corner view of the beach, boardwalk, etc..! The rooms themselves are very nice 3-star accommodations; fairly roomy, always clean, and with a small refrigerator. Our rooms had a nce flat screen TV (with working remote), and an excellent shower. The pool and bar-b-que areas are also nicely maintained. Maybe the best part about The Surfer is that it's affordable; believe me, you won't find another hotel in S.D. that's rght on the beach (with a pool and ocean views) in this price range - and, as other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel's location is not only on the beach, but in an area with plenty of restaurant (and bar) options. What I REALLY don't understand are those reviewers who have complained about the desk staff. To me they all seem friendly, fun, knowledgable, and eager to help -- and they all speak excllent English (I have no idea where the compaint about "non-English speaking staff" came from - unless he was referring to the maids.) When my car wouldn't start, one of the staff gave me a jump with his own car and jumper cables! If you can't get along with this staff, YOU have a problem!! A few restaurant suggestions within easy walking distance: World Famous -- ask for a table on the boardwalk window and enjoy geat people watching. Very reaonable prices for breakfast and lunch. Good bar as well. The Eggery -- Excellent breakfast place, but no view at all! Nick's at the Beach -- Nice neighborhood restaurant. Upstairs bar. P.B. Brewery -- Brewery brew and brewery food. ever been, but I hear it's good. Would I stay at the Surfer again - I do every summer and will continue to d so.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach access, but do not expect too much else.”
Reviews.Author: Dubaychris
Reviews.Content: The beach access was the best part of this hotel. The internet pictures make this place look a lot better than they actually are. The world Famous restaurant was great. The rooms were very small and not user friendly. I did not have a hair dryer, or microwave like it was advertised. The TV was old and the remote did not work, the shower did not work well, it amounted toa slow little stream of water, the room was old and sink holes in the carpet. Poor lighting, I had problems using my room card it wouldn't open the door, so I needed to replace often. The staff was friendly, but for the most part did not speak any english, so when I need a hair dryer or soap, they did not understand, infact they would hide in another room when you tried to talk to them. They thought I was checking out a day earlier than I was and came into the room at least five times, when I asked them what was going on, they had a hard time explaining, and understanding that I was staying another night. You have to pay for parking, which I thought was higher then the rest of the parking places. The pool was cooler than I expected and always had ducks swimming in it, so I chose not to use. The view from the balcony was okay, I was on the third floor, I overlooked the roof top of the restaurant, and it wasn't pretty. Definitely ask for the 4th floor. The vents for the restaurant were directed at our room, so we constantly had the grill smoke and exhaust coming at us....at times it got overwhelming, especially early in the morning for the breakfast crowd. The ice vending machine was out of the way, and to use the door to this and the pool and the beach you had to use an access code, not the room key card, which I kept forgetting the number code. Not user friendly. The lamps would not go on unless you plugged them into the wall and go off only when unplugging from the wall. Also no hot tub, which was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “It's about the LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: pinkpositive
Reviews.Content: I gave it an overall 4 stars because of the location! It is right on the beach and for the price it is hard to beat! Stay on the 4th floor or your view will be obscured by a restaurant (I took this advice from this site and BELIEVE ME on this one!). I can't say anything about the pool. I didn't use it. I did sleep however every night with the balcony door open and went to sleep to sweet sounds of the ocean. It wasn't the nicest hotel I have ever been to, but it was the best location... a good value for the area... I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mpdu2
Reviews.Content: Awesome price for a place right on the beach in the coolest town. Wasn't fancy but didn't need to be. Pool was clean, on-site restaurant rocked, and the front desk staff were nice. Got to check out very late (8PM) and only paid 1/2 price for the extra time. We were there in off -season so it was quiet. I'm sure it's crazy though in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax and watch the sea”
Reviews.Author: wylie77
Reviews.Content: My Partner and i ended up here for what turned out to be 2 nights instead on just one....the view was just too nice and the welcome was warm and friendly -they guy checking in before us will probably write a bad review but he was rude and impatient....so got no sea view.....we followed......but got a sea view...go figure! Will stay again if/when we visit San Diego again

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For...”
Reviews.Author: tajikpeace
Reviews.Content: The Surfer Beach Hotel is in a great neighborhood with tons of restaurants within walking distance. It's also right on the beach, which is nice. But, that's where the good stuff pretty much ends. First of all, while their "ocean view" rooms do, in fact, face the ocean, their visibility is severely hindered by the room of another 1-story building in front of their hotel. We reserved a third-floor ocean view junior suite, but the reservationist entered the wrong date in their computer (good thing I had my printed confirmation). So, they offered either a 3rd floor suite with a king (a free upgrade) or a fourth floor regular with two twins. Even though it was our anniversary, we chose the room with two twins since the view of the ocean from the suite was blocked by that roof. Still, the night stand literally fell off the wall while we were there. On the positive side, the bathroom was in decent shape.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for a better spot!”
Reviews.Author: gcarswell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right on the beach, the views are amazing! We had a monster balcony as well with chairs and table already set up. We had our six year old with us and he loved it, the staff were very friendly, and the pool was nice and warm:) Our room was huge, two double beds and a pullout, also very clean. The room had a sink, microwave and bar fridge so we were able to cut back on dining out as well. You can't ask for a better spot than this!

Reviews.Title: “probably would not return”
Reviews.Author: J-ME-19
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with husband and children, and my parents stayed also in their own room. I made it clear in reservations that we were traveling together, but when I checked in they had us on 2 different floors and could not give us rooms closer together. The front desk lacked much customer service most of our stay. The room looked recently remodeled and was fairly comfortable. The view of the beach was over the top of a dirty restaurant roof. The pool was empty and under construction, though arrangements were made for guests to use the pool at the Best Western next door. We had our door open to the sound of the waves all night, and did not hear any noise (we were top floor on the end of the building) Though my parents who were 2 floors down and in a room more toward the center of the building (it's an L shape) had a sleepless night with partying guests until 3:30 am, and then when they finally quieted down (after a call to the front desk), the neighbors above them came home and stomped around above them until 5am. Our first morning we had to take cold showers because there was no hot water. I called the front desk, they said they would tell maintenance, but they did not seem sympathetic at all. The next morning was fine. Though this motel (called a Hotel) was clean and comfortable (in our King room) I would probably not stay here again. I like to actually sleep at night, and it seems from experience and other reviews that it is hit and miss at this motel. I am not willing to take the chance. I would rather drive to the beach if it means getting a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: lulufung
Reviews.Content: Great location, average accommodations. I stayed there with my husband and my 2 kids (3 years old and 3 months old). Hotel was on the beach with direct access to the beach from the back stairways-this feature was AWESOME. Room was average. Clean but a bit run-down. The noise I've read in other reviews are true but it did not bother us. The noise was from a "street show" on the beach. From our room, we had the best view of that show! The microwave, fridge and sofa bed was a nice bonus. Ralph's Grocery Store and various eateries were just steps away. Because of the outside corridors, this place is more motel than hotel. Pacific Beach was a great destination. I would return and wouldn't mind staying at Surfer Beach Hotel but I would opt to try something else in the same vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for beach access not the room!”
Reviews.Author: xanthia11
Reviews.Content: After leaving the Sheraton we called around to find a hotel and this one was recommended as a wonderful hotel. When we got in the room I about passed out. It was so small and the pull out bed wouldn't even pull out because it hit the bathroom wall. We had to move the bed sideways and it was like sleeping on wire. The handicap bath was almost as big as the room but the showerhead kept falling off and water was getting everywhere. We told the front desk who seemed less than interested. The next day the shower head fell off again and my son fell and hit his head. There is no airconditioning so it is very hot in the rooms at night and the beds are terribly uncomfortable. The only great thing about The Surfer is the beach is outside your door!

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are stick man”
Reviews.Author: lawsclan
Reviews.Content: After we checked into the front desk and got our luggage to go up to the room. My husband heard the staff snicker about how much luggage we had for 2 days. Not that is was their business, but the luggage was for a 10 day trip. 2 of which would be at that hotel. Which was cut down to 1 day because it was such an awful hotel. I wondered how the maid and grounds keeper knew how long we were staying anyway! If you go to this hotel, DO NOT reserve a regular room! I didn't realize the difference between a regular room and the junior suite. There is a HUGE difference, the regular room is so small that my husband hurt his back because he had to twist through the front door to get our suitcases in the room. Here was NO ROOM for our 4 SMALL pieces of luggage. We were in room 203 on the second floor. A large sized person might not make it though the door into the room! They had two beds, which looked smaller than full's, crammed into a very small space. The mattresses were set into a square pressed board, make shift frame. Which ALL of us kept hitting our toes and knees on, we ended up having to put our luggage around the corners to keep from hitting our legs, but we still kept hitting our toes. You had to squeeze past the bed to get out on the patio, the screen door may as well have not even been there, it was broken and very hard to open and close. There were only 3 towels and 1 washcloth, I had to go down to get my own towels. If you ask for towels to the pool, you have to sign a card and personally return them to the office! It didn't matter, the pool was freezing! I will say though, it is a great location, right on the beach, if you are going to stay here get a larger room!

Reviews.Title: “we liked it!”
Reviews.Author: travelntime
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here Cinco de Mayo weekend with family. It's nicely appointed, nothing fancy. But the location is awesome! California beaches are like nowhere else. There are great boardwalk places right outside the hotel overlooking the beach. Crazy characters everywhere. There was a surf competition going on the first morning we woke up.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dentarthurdent
Reviews.Content: Having read Tripadvisor reviews, I thought I knew what to expect at the Surfer Beach (basic rooms, good location) - but still came away disappointed. Yes, hot drinks are available in reception, and staff were helpful(ish). Unfortunately, the previous reviewer is wrong in assuming that the whole hotel has been updated (despite what it says on the hotel's website. We had two rooms (over 2 nights) and both had shower cubicles made up almost entirely of cracked/chipped tiles. My mood wasn't helped by the fact the it was the worst accomodation we stayed in during an 11 day California trip (even worse than a 1-star motel in Pasadena) - despite costing 60% more than our hotels in SF and Monterey. PS. The broken swimming pool heater mentioned by another previous reviewer must have been a bit more serious, as they were in the process of tearing out the pool while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: creativeillusion
Reviews.Content: The front desk modified our reservations with ease to get a room that suited our tastes. Thereâ€™s always hot coffee/tea/hot chocolate available in the lobby and the front desk is very accommodating â€“ giving you beach towels or anything else you may need while youâ€™re there. Our room had been recently renovated (I believe the whole hotel has) and was very clean, trendy, and had a comfortable bed. The location is great, in walking distance to restaurants and bars. (Note there is no alcohol allowed on the beach and the boardwalk lacks places to stop and grab a drink without eating). Parking was very easy. The hotel has a lot reserved for guests, and even on one of the most popular beach days of the year (it was almost 90!), there was ample parking. I highly recommend this hotel for an affordable, clean, and convenient place to stay on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: stephanie01966
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel. The "vibe" was great, the room was nice (even with an ocean view over the roof,) but most of all, the staff was fantastic. Great personal service. Great location. We'd stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Felt very mislead!”
Reviews.Author: concoulor
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was in-fact clean, which I guess is most important - but we never had a full set of towels. We stayed 6 nights and one day we had 1 wash cloth, next day we were short hand towels, next, bath mat...and never received extra towels when requested. The Jr. suite is the size of any double hotel room, perhaps smaller, when we pulled out the queen couch it touched wall to wall and we had to climb over our children to get to the bathroom. The mattresses were absolutely atrocious! We didn't have pillow-top and you sunk into the bed half- way down. We did receive clean sheets, probably because we stripped the beds ourselves and requested the service. It had a pedestal sink and one tiny shelf in the bathroom and the top of the toilet was covered with extra decorative stuff - so there was no room for your personal belongings. I would have liked a hair blower and a full- length mirror. Very small room, TV remote batteries died and we never received new ones, pool heater was out for entire week - had to use Best Western pool. Because the hotel allows smoking and dogs, we had to listen to barking and breath-in cigarette smoke instead of fresh ocean air - if we wanted our windows open. Also, there was noise from the biker-bar two doors down until 2am. when we tried to make other hotel plans, we were told it would cost us 30% of remaining reservation. $11 per day for parking to boot. I guess it's a bit of my fault about smoking, parking and reservation small print. Nonetheless, No, wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tbug27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Surfer Beach Hotel in March. It is worth the price for the location. It is right on the beach! You can listen to the roar of the ocean all night. Definitely request a room on the 4th floor. We didn't have any problems with noise or other guests. The room was nice with a pillow top bed. My only complaints are $12/day parking fee, no microwave, and no hair dryer. The Best Western next door looks nicer, but it was slightly more expensive with only partial ocean views. I would stay at Surfer Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good price value”
Reviews.Author: sylvain007
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in 2 junior suites room. The location is really perfect (in front of the beach), there is parking space available for the hotel. The room is correct, a little bit better than the classic hotel, but not as nice as the expensive one (we discussed to have a really good price). The room we had, has a jacuzzi, a king size bed, a coach and 2 TVs. The view on the beach is cool, and the place was really quiet (expect if you open the big windows, you listen the ocean...). The wifi is expensive (7$/24h with AT&T), but I was able to connect with some difficulties to unsecured spots.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: smbmgd314
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel blind for the last two days of our trip to so. Cal. I did call and request ocean view after booking through Expedia. What a great surprise. Not only did we get 4th floor full ocean view, but the room was very clean and nice. I know the Pacific Beach area well, but wasn't sure how the rooms would be. The interior was updated and decorated, and you can tell they have invested in some upgrades. The balcony was spacious for 4 people to watch the sunset. Super easy and secure access to the boardwalk. Staff very friendly and helpful. We were able to check in early and enjoy some extra beach time with a free cappacino from the lobby. Thanks for an awesome vacation closer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to naysayers!”
Reviews.Author: rnbnut
Reviews.Content: Look, do your research! If you want a GREAT location for under $100, this is it. It's not the Hyatt! It's a little funky, O.K. But it's clean, very well maintained, and most rooms have a wonderful view. Did I mention location? Tons of restaurant choices within a short walk. The Eggery, across the parking lot, is very popular for breakfast, and we had excellent delivery pasta from Capri Pizza and Pasta (tortellini and canneloni) for dinner. But there are far too many to list. I MUST mention the staff. From reservations to check-in to housekeeping we dealt with the friendliest, most helpful staff I've ever seen. And I travel a LOT! Did I mention location? Well, Pacific Beach is a gem. We lucked into this fact while doing online research, and we were not disappointed. It's definitely geared towards a younger crowd, (we're in our 50's), but we had a ball. They may have a local ordinance requiring friendliness and happiness, I don't know for sure. Besides all the restaurants there are numerous nightspots, a great beach, and it's close to many activities as well as downtown San Diego, Sea World, and the airport. By the way, I arrived there with a recently sprained ankle in a walking brace, and it rained both days we were there. I still loved it! Anyone who can't appreciate a good thing when they experience it should just stay home! Or spring for the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: scarlet3egonias
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel for two nights during the week. The hotel has a great location. Walking distance to everything you might need for a short beach vacation. The staff was friendly. There aren't many accomodations there but you're paying for the location and the view. The room had a balcony with a wonderful view of the boardwalk and the beach. It was great to just relax and watch the surfers. The room was clean and updated. We felt safe there and the noise outside was minimal. Beds are comfy and the pool was nice. Overall, for the price I will stay there again the next time I go to Pacific Beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Surfer is Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: lesbriggs
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews must be from people who only stay at the fancy joints; what do they expect for $100 a night? Actually, this place is just exactly what we like: A clean room right on the beach with a great view from the patio (get a room on the 4th floor), and close to all sorts of beach bars, restaurants, etc. The room had a refrigerator, no microwave or coffee pot (I always bring my own, and there's free coffee in the lobby), and $8/day (BOO!) WiFi access (I couldn't find any hot spots to pilfer). You just can't beat going to sleep every night to the sound of the surf! The World Famous restaurant on the premises is great and reasonably priced. There is a clean pool. The whole place is low key and perfect for a very laid back vacation on the beach without spending a bundle. Erin at the front desk is great, and helped make our stay lots of fun. We spent 9 very relaxing days at the Surfer, and still didn't want to go home. We've stayed here many times and will keep coming back

Reviews.Title: “what a flop house-no flop houses are better”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMadtraveler
Reviews.Content: After a long day of travel from richmond va my husband and I were looking forward to a relaxing great honeymoon on the beach We checked into the room at the surferbeach The place was A DUMP with 2 box fans for airconditioning and it smelled like mold!!! Lucky for us we got a great room across the street at the Best Western but had it been summer we wouldn't have been so lucky. I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS SITE IS SO MISREPRESENTED . If it was updated I hate to see what it looked like before. The sign in the office should have had said we accept payment by the hour!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. How can you complain when you can roll out of bed in the morning, step out on your balcony/porch, and hear that ocean and those waves crashing? That, in itself, is why i loved my stay at the Surfer. Yeah maybe the rooms weren't 4 or 5 star, maybe you did get stuck with a not-so-good view..Deal with it! You are literally steps away from the beach. The location was wonderful as well. I remember mulitple things about the location. And I will just name a few: PB Pier, surfboard rental shoppes, little ice cream stands, the boardwalk at night was beautiful (although could get loud), restaurants gallore, Starbucks just around the corner, Ralphs just down the street, THE OCEAN JUST STEPS AWAY FROM YOU..i could go on and on, but what it comes down to, is you don't pay to sit on your butt all day in your hotel room and try to nit-pick at the quality of the rooms. You're paying for this room because of the nostalgia of your location and what most everyone comes to PB for, that surf and sun. I loved my stay here, and will continue to visit in years to come. I loved the staff, loved the view i had, and loved being able to sit out by their firepit at night and listen to the ocean, IF my feet weren't in the sand.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I saw in the brochure.”
Reviews.Author: 521red
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was nice. The facilities are fine, but I was stuck in a room with no air conditioning and no view. Had to use fans with open windows. This is not how I want to spend $330.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but a Dump”
Reviews.Author: tbari
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here 4 yrs ago (with friends), this place was named "Surfer Motor Lodge" and it was a total dump. At the time, we just wanted to stay close to the beach, so in that we got what we wanted. The location is def. prime, which is why these guys get to charge a premium. Don't remember how much it cost, but it was basically a motel (at best). The bathrooms were disgusting and small, the bathroom sink is basically in the bed room and there is no air conditioning in the rooms. There was a pool, but it didn't look remotely decent. My girlfriend and I just went to San Diego and were looking for a hotel close to the beach that was normal. We decided on this place b/c we got a "decent rate" of $265/night - must have been a pricey week to travel b/c most other hotels were $300/night. Remembering how dirty and worn down this place was during my last stay, I was pleasantly surprised to see that it had been renovated and renamed. Don't be fooled - with the exception of a paint job, some new Ikea furniture and paintings from Target, this is the same place as before. My girlfriend dreaded taking a shower at this hotel. The biggest complaint -- we left for the beach between the hrs of 10am - 3pm both days we were there, and when we returned, the room was still not cleaned. Nothing worse than coming back to a dirty room. I would also echo the comments made by the post titled - Surfer Beach Hotel: "Disappointed by Surfer Beach Hotel" on Jun 29, 2006. Just saw the comments now (unfortunately) and agree 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable but would not go back”
Reviews.Author: LesterB
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in February while visiting my daughter who lives nearby. It is really motel-like, my room was very small and seemed old even tho the furnishings were stylish. The view from the walkway to the room was of giant dumpsters and some really crappy apartments. Did enjoy hearing the waves at night. Glad I was on an upper floor as there were some skanky people out on the boardwalk (not the hotel's fault.) Staff very pleasant. I paid $99 a night, would have been really annoyed to pay any more than that as it was just so-so.

Reviews.Title: “My wife loved it. So that says alot.”
Reviews.Author: Chrispmoto
Reviews.Content: First off. Excellent location. It really cant be beat. The staff was very friendly. Excellent free coffee and hot chocolate. The room looked awesome when we walked in. Secondly. Sure, if you wanted to nit pick, you could. One person complained about the hide a bed. Yeah, when folded out, it was hard to get around. Big deal. Deal with it. Fold the bed up sooner. Also, someone said "when you look out, all you see is rooftop of the restaraunt". Yeah, look about 10 feet to the right, and all you see is a nice beach and acean. Some people are just too fussy. I didnt even get a good deal on this place, and I still liked it. The things I remember are the excellent beach views, the dolphins playing in the surf everyday, and the sounds of the waves putting me to sleep. We rented bikes, I surfed right outside the Hotel, and the people were very friendly. We would stay there again. I cant figure out how this Hotel gets such a relatively low rating here on tripadvisor. There must be some REALLY nice hotels here in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: SleeplessWa
Reviews.Content: I've read a lot of the reviews and must say that I'm surprised by the negative ones. You get what you pay for! Ocean front property in San Diego is worth a mint! There are newer, nicer places to stay on the beach but you'll pay atleast double the price. If you are on a tight budget you should be thankful that the Surfer is an option for you. Otherwise, stay somewhere nicer "off beach" and walk to the shore. I was born and raised in PB back in the 60's and 70's. The Surfer was old way back then. It was a place for real surfers to crash. I think they even rented by the month like an apartment. I think that for the price, it's a decent place to stay. You don't go to the beach to sit in your room anyway! The only draw back that I can think of is that the restaraunt is no longer affiliated with the hotel like it was back in the day so you can't order snacks and drinks poolside. Oh well, pick up snacks at the nearby grocery store and BYOB. Works for me! If you want an upscale hotel, this is not the place for you. If you want decent and affordable in a great location, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the $$...”
Reviews.Author: jcpickern
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, let me say that The Surfer Beach Hotel is in a VERY central location. If you are looking to stay at the beach and people watch this is a great location. If you are honeymooning, a retiree, or a family with small children this is not the place for you. The atmosphere is young and at times a little rowdy. The staff at the hotel is great and willing to please. The beds are comfortable, we chose to stay in a standard room with a king bed. The balconies have a great view of the most happening spot in PB, and you can slip on your suit and walk maybe 10 feet to the sand. The best part of the rooms is not what is inside, but what is available just outside. At night we slept with our sliding glass door to the balcony open and fell asleep to the sound of the waves crashing against the shore. Luv it! Of course, there are a few fall backs to the place. The rooms are not very big, but they serve their purpose. The rooms have been updated in style, although one can tell it is still an older building. Also, one thing I was shocked by was the fact that all of the rooms have exterior entrances. It is not a Hotel where the only access is from the inside only, it is a Motel with outside entrances. The bathrooms are somewhat of a joke if you are taller than 5'4. The shower heads require squatting, so be prepared to work out! Overall our stay was enjoyable for the money, and yes we will stay there again. You can't beat the rate for the location! And if you choose to stay there be sure to eat at World Famous, we did for about 4 different meals and the food was great. Try the Puerto Nuevo Lobster Tacos!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ConsumerTravelwriter
Reviews.Content: You can come up with fancy names like boutique hotel, but if it walks like a duck and quacks like a duck, well then it's a duck. The Surfer Hotel is a 4 storey MOTEL. It's priced as a Hotel and that means you'll be overcharged for basic amenities of a MOTEL. The arrogance of the general manager who insincerely pretended that my disappointment really mattered was very Motel 6. Each room overlooks the ugly rooftop of the restaurant below ironically named "World's Best". The paint coming off the shower walls was an extra delight. If you are a student and you just want to be on the beach go for it. If you are past your College-"let's see how much beer we can drink" -years, and you're looking for a well run hotel where people "wake-up" not "come-to" from a night of shooters and drinking out of funnels and test tubes, stay elsewhere. I wish I would have spent more time visiting the other hotels on the boardwalk before booking. Try the Catamaran across the street, The Oceanside down the road or the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “o.k. for the money”
Reviews.Author: lucin
Reviews.Content: we booked a king room but all that was availabe was a double. the room was clean, however we did not have HBO in the room. the shower head seemed really low, we had to bend down to use it. The worse part was hearing everything in the room above us, we were in room 202. If I stayed here again, I would want a room on the fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “We Would Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: ZumaCincinnati
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from January 17th through January 22nd. We had originally booked only two nights but added three more after actually seeing it/staying there. The location cannot be beat. We walked along the ocean endlessly, walked to breakfast, etc. We loved the staff especially April, Juan, and Heather. Very nice and helpful. We stayed in Room 304 and had a great view of the ocean. Very clean room. We were NOT charged for parking. We paid less than $100 per night (in the off-season). The coffee in the lobby (Boyd's) was delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Ucan2can
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Surfer's for 16 days. This is the longest I have ever stayed at one hotel anywhere in the world. I travel extensively and this is a Great Spot, on the beach, and a great price, $105 a night including tax. Everything here is so close that in reality you don't need a car. I only put 300 miles on my rental. Fox Car Rentals, a new company with great cars and prices. It would have been just as easy and much cheaper to take a taxi from the airport and just walk around the area. There are great resturants, grocery stores, drug stores, Starbucks, and two gyms within two blocks of the hotel. There is a place to rent bikes, roller blades, and surf boards right next door. The staff, Heather, Juan, and the Manager April Risk, were more than just helpful they were unfailing nice and upbeat. The Surfer's was refurbished a couple of years ago and so the rooms are quite pleasant, the towels are great, etc. The reason to go here though is because all of the rooms face the ocean. Be sure to get one above the 1st floor. The boardwalk is right out front and you can go for four miles on it. Or walk on the beach. If you are worried about noise bring ear plugs. Otherwise jsut enjoy a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing and going down hill fast...”
Reviews.Author: simonwim
Reviews.Content: This was the second time weve stayed at this hotel, dissapointed with the room this time. We stayed in room 206, you could hear EVERY movement the people in room 306 above made, even all their bathroom visits!! When they used the water it was practially impossible to hear anything in our room for the noise. Our shower head was 4 feet off the floor, we had to sit down in the show stall to shower! the sink was in the bedroom not the bathroom! very poor water pressure aswell. Patio door wouldnt open, kept jamming. Poor TV reception. The only saving grace is the Location, however there are others we will use next time in just as good a Location for very little more money. The restraunt underneath the hotel however is FANTASTIC, World Famous offers fantastic food and views while dining. Even the Cafe" Be Curious" on the boardwalk next to the hotel is excellent value for money, both of these are highly recomended, however the hotel isnt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation - Great Management”
Reviews.Author: Andy-Kuiper
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel late in the evening and found my booking agent had messed up and had only reserved a room for one night instead of the three I'd been billed for. Jaun, the hotel's assistant manager, happened to be working and was super helpful. He arranged for me to stay the one night and then promised to arrange a room for the next two nights. Jaun, and his staff, did that and more. The next day they found me a nicer room with a great view. As a result of the super treatment I received from the hotel's staff, the perfect beach location, and the cleanliness and safety of the hotel as a whole, I chose to extend my stay to five nights. This hotel has a great location, and while it isn't the newest property on the beach, it's very well managed and the staff are friendly and willing to help with local advice and directions. The room was very clean, everything worked, and my stay was a real pleasure. Thank you Jaun and all the staff at the Surfer Beach Hotel Andy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with young child!”
Reviews.Content: I found myself and young son stuck in San Diego for an extra night with no place to stay. I called the Surfer, and they were able to check me in at 9am with no problems, and at a much better rate than I have paid at nearby properties in the past. We had what is probably the worst room in the hotel, in the corner on the first floor. The room ended up being perfect for us in spite of the less than ideal location. My 2 year old loved looking out our patio at all of the people in the pool and walking by. We were able to make it from our room to the beach in about 2 minutes, me carrying 2 year old and all of our gear. There were tons of families staying here during our stay,and we had no problems with noise at all. There are plenty of child friendly dining options nearby as well. The staff were very helpful, especially when my son came down with the stomach flu and we needed new sheets (they brought them promptly several times). I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend from NYC & Long Island”
Reviews.Author: jbarger75
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect location...right on the beach. We had really no problems with our stay what so ever. We are returning very soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Got Kids? Stay away from the Surfer Beach Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FunFamilyVac
Reviews.Content: This is not a place for families with kids! Pacific Beach is a college age party beach. Alcohol is allowed on the beach and the twenty-somethings take full advantage of it. This is a beach for locals, not visitors. (There's also a really bad rip tide). I didn't like exposing my kids to the drunkeness, smoking, cursing and other rowdy behavior and checked out after one day. NO A/C was a big problem. The nice ocean breeze was ruined by cigarette smoke from our neighbors, delivery trucks out back, and young people yelling at each other all night long somehow creatively working the "F" word into every sentence. And did I mention they charged $300/night for this??? (Should be under $100) We checked out and went to The Hotel Del for $335/night and had an absolutely fabulous stay (as usual, we've been there before). Forget trying new things, you just can't do better than The Del.

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING SPECIAL - Great location but expensive & NO AIRconditioning”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler103
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Surfer in July 2006 - Great location right on Pacific Beach - in the middle of the all the college party action. It WAS HOT - keep in mind there is NO AIRCONDITIONING! Also, rooms are tiny compared to pics you see online unless you book the suite? Not sure... but for $400 we thought the room should be bigger. The pool was crowed with kids and surrounded by a gate. If you are on the first floor you cannot see the beach b/c of wall around pool. We had requested a beachview and received a room with a view of the back of the restaurant. Also, security was strict, you cannot have visitors at any time. Remember when packing - no soaps in bathroom and no hairdryer. Plus we were warned that you cannot plug more than one item at a time in outlets. We had a great time in San Diego but this hotel was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Way too pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: mizzbatz
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a one night stay at the Surfer Beach hotel. We were in San Diego for a wedding of a good friend. We had heard of this hotel by him (he had heard form someone else) and after checking out the web site, decided to book there. The parking is difficult as they do not have enough spots for all the guests. This would not be so bad if they also did not charge for parking. We got our room key for our ocean view room. We could see the ocean, if we looked past the pool, roof, and our neighboor's balcony. It was quite warm in our room so I went to turn on the air. There is NO air conditioning in the room at all. It was very stuffy and hot in there. There was a fan with dust all over it to use (should be been an occilating fan, but that was broken). We simply had to move it to wherever we were. The sheets had a few holes in them. We had to call down for a hair dryer at one point. When my husband called to enquire if they have one, the front dest replied that they did, but did not offer to bring it up, we had to go get it. When we got back from the wedding, we went to open the slider to get some cool air in, but there were people sitting on the balcony right next to ours, putting them about eighteen inches from our door. For one night, our bill was $300, way too much for this place. We will make sure to stay somewhere else next time. If the whole thing had been less than $100 it would have been worth it. The only thing that they have going for them was that our bed was comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Mix of young adults and families - and a Great location in PB!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed part of the 4th of July week with 2 young children. The location is fabulous, albeit a little crazy this time of year. The staff did a very good job of maintaining order, and provided a very good room choice for a family. The crowd is mixed. You get college kids four to a room who are there to party on Garnet Street, along with a significant number of families, even grandmas and grandpas. Keeping everything clean is a tough job with a combination of lots of little kids and party-going young adults, but everything was very clean. We did not have a noise problem either, but this is a very busy location. This is pretty much the center of the action for PB. Rooms are nice. My only complaint is our hide-a-bed was so uncomforable I slept on it in the couch position. This is a best choice if you are looking for a great PB location right on the beach with a spectacular view of the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Surfer Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NPJ50
Reviews.Content: I tend to be more of a lurker than a reviewer, and in fact I put off writing this for several months. But now that I'm back looking at Trip Advisor for another trip, I realize I need to provide this feeback so other people get an accurate picture of the Surfer Beach Motel rather than the oddly inflated picture that some of the reviews provide. I went this hotel based on the glowing Trip Advisor reviews. The difference between what I'd read about the place and what I found in reality was huge. The place was basically a tacky motel, albeit in a great location. The room, which faced the dumpster on an alley, was mediocre with bare, dingy walls. The beds were sort of gussied up, which helped a bit. The bathroom was ridiculous. It was tiny, with no tub and the tiniest little shower stall that made showering a truly unpleasant experience. Worse yet, the bathroom door was warped and did not close. Didn't even come close to closing. Given how much we paid for the room, I was pretty shocked at how tacky it was. I have never before paid so much for so little, and I've done my share of traveling. The walls were thin. This is a big problem when one's 11-year-old starts asking why she's hearing moaning and rhythmic thuds on the other side of the wall. Enough said about that... On the plus side, the location can't be beat. Even though we had no beach view, we were able to be on the beach in just moments, and it was a fun area for strolling.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I found this hotel through [--]. We chose to stay there because it was right on the beach and affordable. When we got to the hotel I was worried because the back side of it looks like a motel and I will not stay in a motel! We went into our room and it was very nice. It wasn't your regular hotel room. The room was modernized and spacious. Our room had an ocean view which most of the rooms do. We watched dolphins jumping around in the morning which isnt something you see everyday living in Phoenix. Overall, this hotel was perfect for us. It was located on the beach and close to all of San Diegos attractions. The room was attractive and had a different look from most hotel rooms. Unless you are used to Hiltons, this is a perfect hotel to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “I'm going back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My college-age daughter and I stayed at Surfer Beach last Novemeber and I couldn't believe the value we got compared to the prices of other hotels in the area. Right on Pacific Beach we could listen to the waves as we slept. Our balcony on the 3rd floor gave us a great view of the ocean and we ate breakfast on the balcony while we watched the many early morning surfers. (see photo) The room was very clean and roomy and nicely decorated.(see photo) The staff was very friendly. I had seminars during the day and it was only a 15 minute drive to Fashion Valley. My daughter spent the days enjoying the beach or exploring the area on foot. Lots of shopping within walking distance. She felt safe the whole time. I plan to stay here again this fall.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great location, right on the beach but there are several motels right on the beach in the same area. I was offended by the staff and security guard and the maid service leaved a lot to be desired. It was very expensive for what you got. I frequent San Diego and will never stay in this motel again. Watch out for room cleanliness and staff rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I went to visit my niece who attends San Diego State for a few days. On our first night we were talking on our balcony in a regular tone of voice. The phone rang and we were told that our voices were carrying and that we needed to go inside! The office staff had the screen door open 24/7 and were listening to everything (almost looking for something to happen) while at the same time we had a security guard starring up at us every night we were there. At one point a lady from the office came outside and screamed up, "If I hear one more peep out of one of those two rooms..." I wasn't sure if she was addressing us but we weren't doing anything. It seemed as though she was looking directly at us though. We were confused! No guests complained about us it was just the staff listening in and waiting for something to happen. The first morning we were there we went down to the lobby (if you can even call it that!) to get coffee and over heard the woman at the desk saying something about our room and how pissed we were, we were totally confused. When the lady had called the night before we were very apologetic and told her we didn't realize we were even being loud. We decided not to confront the staff while overhearing them talk about our room because we were already hip to their rude character!!! Furthermore, the cable TV was a joke, you couldn't watch anything as their satelite was all screwed up! The maid service was terrible! The coffee machine was broken for the last two mornings we were there. We would go into the lobby and say good morning and the woman they had in there in the mornings just glared at you and didn't even greet you!!! DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return to the Surfer!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Surfer Beach for a week in March 2005 and absolutely LOVED the Surfer and San Diego! The people were very friendly everywhere. Our favorite part of the trip was waking up each morning for breakfast at The Eggery restaurant about 2 minutes walking distance from the Surfer. The food and service there was amazing. The hotel is in a great location, right on the beach and within walking distance to plenty of night life (especially on Garnet Ave.) It's been almost a year since we've been there and still talk about the Surfer Beach Hotel, San Diego, and of course The Eggery! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Once again--loved it.”
Reviews.Author: PeterLibertyvilleIL
Reviews.Content: Back from another great stay at the Surfer. Ocean view, parking, tax included--$135 a night. How can you beat that??? The rooms are comfortable and clean, the neighborhood is fun, and the location can't be beat. The ONLY drawback is that it can be noisy, but this time--not a problem at all. The balcony privacy dividers are a great improvement, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Try to get an oceanview room in the 4th floor, but other rooms are nice too. We were happy with the location, room amenities and rates. Only critique: cleaning staff didn't do a good job on one occasion. parking fees varied between 6-8$/day.

Reviews.Title: “What a unique and interesting property...”
Reviews.Author: mjs7777
Reviews.Content: We were planning two nights in San Diego after a long road trip. I wanted to find a place on a beach for the first night, then we would move downtown for the second. I looked at a lot of options but hotels in San Diego tend to be very expensive. Priceline wasn't a good choice as there was no way to guarantee we'd actually be on the beach. Tripadvisor can be a wonderful resource in situations like this. I was at the end of my rope, almost ready to just give up on the idea of staying on the beach, when I decided to start from the top and work my way down the list, seeing if anything might work on our budget. I was a little nervous about booking this place; it seemed sort of odd. And it is odd -- in a decidedly good way. You get the sense that someone purchased what must have been a fairly shady motel on the beach and dumped an incredible volume of money and effort into making it something quirky and fun, without sacrificing quality or cleanliness. We booked a standard king room and requested a high floor with an ocean view. Not all views in this hotel are created equal. There are four floors and you really need to be on the top two to get a good view. But the view... WOW. From our balcony, we had an unobstructed panoramic view of the waves rolling in from the Pacific and a decent view of the actual beach itself. We watched the people of San Diego strolling by, walking dogs, surfing... plus the bonus of watching one of the best sunsets ever from our balcony. The rooms have been thoroughly renovated. Sinks feature granite countertops, rooms have brand new beds. Everything is decorated in this quirky, kitschy style. It really works. Wireless Internet access is available for $7.95 for 24 hours (SBC Freedomlink) and has a strong signal.
