There is also an $8 mandatory daily parking charge (up from $6 effective January 1) for access to the lot next to the hotel. Every booking site I checked had the same rate for this hotel, except one Southern California based travel agency whose website offered a 10% prepayment discount. We effectively got the parking for free by booking through them. You should be able to find the site if you search hard enough. Some reviewers have complained about particular features of their rooms. It seems that each room has unique furnishings. I would recommend calling ahead to let them know exactly what you need. They are very accommodating! Other reviewers have complained about noise on the weekends. We stayed on a Tuesday night and had absolutely no issues but I would believe it could be noisy on the weekends. The whole area is probably very noisy. It's quite popular. You might want to request a room at the end of the hall if noise might be a concern for you. One of the recent renovations has been to add custom fabricated privacy dividers between each room. It's still possible, because of the L-shape of the hotel, to see across the courtyard into other rooms, but the safety concern of shared balconies is no longer an issue. The place is not yet perfect. Some of the fixtures should be changed out. The elevator could use a little TLC. These deficiencies can be easily overlooked when you realize the value of the room quality, view, and attention from the outstanding staff compared to how little you're paying. They also make up each room with their signature "towel bunny", a sculpture made from artfully folded towels who welcomes you to the hotel. If you want something a little different, right on the beach, at a phenomenal room rate, you must try the Surfer!

Reviews.Title: “Surfer BUM Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If ALL you like to do is party-stay here. For $250 a night I expected air conditioning not a window fan. The first room had a double bed against a king headboard and futon instead of queen convertible bed. Ocean view was the pool fence. Only one TV too. We requested another room... Second room a bit better-King and a pleather broken queen convertible bed-again no air and one TV. This hotel WILL CHARGE YOU 30% of the nightly rate for the reservation if you shorten your stay!! Still, we moved. "Acting" manager was rude and I will deny charges to my CC!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Surfer Beach Hotel in March of this year. We didn't know what to expect because the rooms were so cheap, but we were pleasantly surprised. The bed was wonderful!! So comfortable and big! Our balcony overlooked the beach and we were able to enjoy amazing sunsets. The restaurant that was connected had great food and a great view. We enjoyed our trip immensely and would definitely stay at Surfer Beach again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and nice rooms with a view.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families and people wanting to stay on the beach. Didn't give it five stars because only a select few hotels are worthy of it. Location is the best. Rooms are modern and bed was very comfortable. Clean rooms as well. Restaurant attached is a great place to dine. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for a nice beach stay. If you Marriott five star, then look else where. Overall a great stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, but free food!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending time in downtown San Diego, we checked into this place to discover no air conditioning, but it had free food! The fan in the room had filthy dust, the bedspread and headboard had a film of dust, and there was toilet paper on the floor as we walked in. The door to the patio had chocolate finger prints on the handle. But the best thing was the free food in the floor - M & Ms, Crackers and Sunflower Seeds. YUM! This place ruined what had been a perfect vacation to a disgusting one!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location! Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: mangie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Surfer, during the last week of April for 3 nights. It's a great hotel for the price & you can't beat the location. we had a room on the 3rd floor with an ocean view. there are some rooms that don't face the ocean, but we resquested an ocean view room when we made our reservations & got exactly what we requested. we kept the curtins open almost the whole time just admiring the view from our room. we also kept the sliding door half open with the screen shut & never experienced any problems with noise, just the sound of the waves in the ocean. the room was very clean, the bed was comfortable. their rooms are nicely remodeled & very modern looking. the only complaint that i did have was that the shower is made for shorter people. i have read this issue in a previous post, so i knew what to expect. i'm 5'7, & i did have to bend down a bit when washing my hair, but it really wasn't a major problem. the surfer was like a 10 min. drive from everything. i would totally recommend this hotel for someone who is looking for a hotel on the ocean and close to all tourist attractions in san diego. thanks surfer for making our trip to san diego very memorable!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bad room layout”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at surfer beach hotel in a jr. suite march 2005. The staff was very nice, however would have expected a better view for being in a suite it was stuck in the corner. When I pulled out the sofa bed for my kids to sleep on I had to move a dresser with a tv on it all the way against the wall, move the sofa against the wall and then there was barely enough room to lay the bed out. Then if you wanted to use the bathroom or balcony you had to step on the bed to get over it and to the bathroom. Whom ever designed this room didnt think it through very well. Other than that it was good. The restaurant attached to the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but don't stay there on the weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that this hotel is a great value. It is on the beach, and we stayed there for $94.00 /night. While our particular room didn't really "look out" over the ocean, we could hear it (if we left the patio door cracked open). The area outside of our patio door was not private enough to leave the curtains open, and the view wasn't anything to miss anyway. The room itself was clean, nice looking, and had lots of amenities. The bathroom was clean and worked well. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful, and concerned. Parking was easy, but had an additional cost. I think we paid like... $36 for the week. There were many other advantages to being in this casual a hotel environment (for example, we stored our bikes in the room). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay during the week, but Friday night there was horribly loud partying in the room directly above us, until about 4 AM. It sounded like they were continuously rearranging the furniture, punctuated by occasional audible explosions of beer bottles being tripped over. At one point, I heard another guest yelling across the courtyard at them to shut up. The next morning, I spoke with the manager. To the hotel's credit, he gave me a discount for the night, and assured me it would not be allowed to happen again that night. He was genuinely upset that this had happened. Although the manager did what he could to remedy the problem, in the end we decided to go to a different hotel later that morning. We began to understand the unlikeliness that there are any quiet weekend nights at this hotel. My advice- a great place to stay on the ocean, Monday-Friday. Find another place to stay for the weekend, unless you don't plan on sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good find.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here after reading the reviews on this site. We needed someplace clean, close to the beach and a good value. We weren't disappointed. Although, I don't ideally want to have a direct view of the pool, which all the nearby hotels had, the ocean was a few feet behind it and we were fully able to enjoy it from the balcony--which is an enclosed, shared space for the entire floor. For what we spent per night we felt that we hit the lottery with this hotel. Our room was clean and the bathroom was recently updated and for the little amount of time we actually spent in the room vs. our time on the beach, it was a great find. The restaurant located in the same building, World's Famous, had great food and plenty of fans, which was another huge bonus...make sure to get reservations first!

Reviews.Title: “Awful place!”
Reviews.Author: jck33
Reviews.Content: I believed the positive reviews here and booked the place for four nights. We high-tailed it out of there after an hour. We booked the "junior suite" because it promised oceanfront views for those rooms. We checked in, went up the room and found a view of the swimming pool and the mechanical stuff on the hotel's roof. If we looked off to the right (along an open, shared balcony), we could see the ocean. Definitely not what we expected. We might have stayed nonetheless, but then we looked at the filthy kitchen area and walked into the bathroom, which smelled strongly of urine. We're not snooty and don't demand lavish accommodations, but this was really awful. One staff person at the desk gave my husband a hard time when we tried to check out after this quick look around, but the man we thought was the manager allowed us to flee. I highly recommend the lovely Best Western directly across the street, which had clean rooms, professional service and private balconies with direct ocean views for only a few dollars more each night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't have any reservations and we just happend to pull into the public parking lot next to the hotel. My husband ran in to check the price of the room and they had a rate of $99. with an ocean view! The room was very nice with new furniture and an art deco look. The only thing they didn't have in our room was a hair dryer but we called down to the front desk and we were able to barrow one. Also no tub, just a stand-up shower but who really takes baths in a hotel? They had free coffee and cappuccino in the lobby. The restaurant that is attached "World Famous" was also very good. The location is very good with plenty of places to eat and little shops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OSUBuck
Reviews.Content: After researching a lot of hotels in San Diego, we finally picked the Surfer Beach Hotel for many reasons. First, it was right on the beach, being from Ohio, we do not see the beach much so since we were staying in San Diego, why not stay on the beach. Second, the price, this was well worth the price and I would have even paid more for what we had. The room was clean and very comfortable and looked right over the beach. The sunset we had was amazing. Last, but not least, the convenient location. We went just about everywhere in San Diego in less than 30 minutes (depending on traffic). We would definitely stay here again and will request it to all of our friends. It was the nicest hotel we have stayed in for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Surfer November 2004 and couldn't pick a more perfect time to be there. Had a room on the fourth floor, beach was literally a stone's throw away. Staff was very friendly. Beach was practically deserted due to the time of year yet the weather was great. I would highly suggest visiting in late October and early November as the rates are much lower and the beach is yours. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. There are quite a few restaurants within walking distance. I always travel by bus when vacationing and was happy to find a bus stop practically at the doorstep. The bus will take you to the Old Town transit where you can catch a bus practically anywhere in San Diego. I am a female solo traveler and would highly recommend this hotel and location for the optimum San Diego expeience. I felt pretty safe and more than a little spoiled by the view of the ocean from my room. Most of the rooms at the Surfer offer a spectacular view. I know the summer rates there are off the charts, but I had no complaints about my November experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? I think not!”
Reviews.Author: cara16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in august 2004 while touring west coast. Nice location. Was listed as a motel in the lonely planet guide, had been "upgraded" to hotel standards when we booked it - NOT! On arrival the staff were very laid back - so laid back the receptionist was having a cigarette outside! We were told our room had a sea view, however I think the customers at the World Famous restaurant had a better view of us. The room itself was fine, the bedlinen was v nice. there was no a/c just a fan. I had to ask for a hairdryer at reception as there was none in the room. I was asked to bring it back in case other guests needed to use it! We stayed during peak season and at $175 per night we found it to be seriously overpriced - I'd still class it as motel standard accommodation. A "hotel" only in name.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Surfer recently and were not impressed. My husband and I are pretty laid back people so we're not that hard to please. We chose this hotel because of the reviews on this site. Initially we had a room on the fourth floor with a nice view. One big problem is with the balconies...there is no divider between the rooms so it's like one big open deck with no privacy. We had many people walking past our sliding door because they wanted to see the view at the end. If you want any light in the room in the daytime you need to have the curtain open, so people were able to peer in as they walked by. Also, there is no air conditioning so it gets fairly hot in the rooms. At night we would open our door to get some air in and leave the screen door closed. Well one night around midnight we were watching tv in bed and I heard our screen door open (it had no lock) as a big hairy arm reached into our room to push the curtain aside. I screamed and my husband jumped up to see who was coming into our room. A man was walking along the balconies and must have "misplaced" his room and muttered "oops, wrong room". Nice consolation for having my heart jump out of my chest! The rooms themselves are quite nice and the beds are comfortable. Although we had a king suite, it isn't all that large, and the bathrooms have absolutely no counter space. There were hairs on almost all our towels, but everything else seemed clean enough....that is until we noticed some kind of bedbugs in our room. We asked to be moved immediately, so with no apology and rude staff, we ended up with a room on the second floor (with barely any view) because the hotel was busy. The next morning we were awoken at 7am sharp with the sound of jackhammers underneath us. They were renovating the first floor...this went on every morning for the rest of our trip. All we were looking for was an apology, but the staff was ignorant and nobody addressed any of our concerns. Needless to say, we won't be staying there again.
